description: Word 2016 advanced explores ways to enhance Word documents with graphical elements that include images, shapes, tables, and charts. The series also demonstrates different techniques for users to automate tasks by using QuickParts, templates, macros, and mail merge. While Word 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Word 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to go beyond just text.
descriptionMD: Word 2016 advanced explores ways to enhance Word documents with graphical elements that include images, shapes, tables, and charts. The series also demonstrates different techniques for users to automate tasks by using QuickParts, templates, macros, and mail merge. While Word 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Word 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to go beyond just text.
name: Word 2016 Advanced
subtitle: Document and word processing software

episodes.description: Word 2016 advanced explores ways to enhance Word documents with graphical elements that include images, shapes, tables, and charts. The series also demonstrates different techniques for users to automate tasks by using QuickParts, templates, macros, and mail merge. While Word 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Word 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to go beyond just text.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:06.007
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:06.007 --> 00:00:10.732
Hello everyone, and
welcome to Microsoft Word 2016 Advanced.

3
00:00:10.732 --> 00:00:14.968
My name is Vonne Smith, and I will be
your host for this this course overview.

4
00:00:14.968 --> 00:00:18.140
And what we're going to be covering
in this course overview is, well,

5
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:21.760
exactly what we're gonna be talking
about throughout these episodes.

6
00:00:21.760 --> 00:00:23.150
Who is this target audience?

7
00:00:23.150 --> 00:00:26.969
Who should be the ones that are watching
these shows in this series?

8
00:00:26.969 --> 00:00:29.666
And do I need to know anything
before we get started?

9
00:00:29.666 --> 00:00:33.870
And any extra tidbits that I might have
for you as we go through everything.

10
00:00:34.920 --> 00:00:38.080
This series is broken up
into two main sections,

11
00:00:38.080 --> 00:00:41.430
we have our graphical elements and
we have automation.

12
00:00:41.430 --> 00:00:43.110
In our graphical elements section,

13
00:00:43.110 --> 00:00:47.690
we're going to be going over how to
insert images in to our Word document.

14
00:00:47.690 --> 00:00:51.210
We'll also be covering shapes and
SmartArt.

15
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:54.247
We'll also be creating and
inserting tables and charts.

16
00:00:54.247 --> 00:00:58.297
For all of these different graphical
objects, we'll be learning how to format

17
00:00:58.297 --> 00:01:02.662
them, make them really pretty, maybe
throw some pink in there and some purple.

18
00:01:02.662 --> 00:01:05.960
We'll also talk about how
to actually position and

19
00:01:05.960 --> 00:01:08.090
word warp these in our document.

20
00:01:08.090 --> 00:01:12.889
So we know exactly where we want to
have them placed in relationship to

21
00:01:12.889 --> 00:01:14.471
the words on the page.

22
00:01:14.471 --> 00:01:18.149
In the automation section, we're gonna
be talking about creating templates.

23
00:01:18.149 --> 00:01:23.257
And exactly what is a template, which I
feel is a misconstrued word sometimes if

24
00:01:23.257 --> 00:01:28.890
we're talking about the technical, correct
way of using a template within Word.

25
00:01:28.890 --> 00:01:30.410
So definitely stay tuned for

26
00:01:30.410 --> 00:01:35.055
that episode, so we can know that
the right way to be using it.

27
00:01:35.055 --> 00:01:39.310
We're also be talking about adding quick
parts, and how the building blocks within

28
00:01:39.310 --> 00:01:43.462
word can be really hardy to make
us a more efficient user of Word.

29
00:01:43.462 --> 00:01:46.940
We're also gonna be reporting macros,
all those steps that you have to do

30
00:01:46.940 --> 00:01:52.230
all the time, record a macro, hit the play
button and make your life a lot easier.

31
00:01:52.230 --> 00:01:56.660
We'll also be inserting linked objects
in from Excel into our Word documents

32
00:01:56.660 --> 00:02:00.730
to be able to pull that information and
generate the content automatically.

33
00:02:00.730 --> 00:02:05.345
And the all important mail merge,
which is a lot of fun, and once you have

34
00:02:05.345 --> 00:02:09.900
figured out how to do those step by
steps it becomes a lot easier for you.

35
00:02:09.900 --> 00:02:11.230
The target audience,

36
00:02:11.230 --> 00:02:15.390
any Office user would be the perfect
person to watch these episodes.

37
00:02:15.390 --> 00:02:17.050
Now, when I say Office,

38
00:02:17.050 --> 00:02:22.000
notice that here it is capitalized
meaning that Office as Microsoft Office.

39
00:02:22.000 --> 00:02:26.192
You use Word on a daily basis
to create documents for

40
00:02:26.192 --> 00:02:29.712
anything that you use in your office work.

41
00:02:29.712 --> 00:02:34.694
Which might be a home office, could be a
large office, could be a large university,

42
00:02:34.694 --> 00:02:39.070
all the different levels of where
your physical office might be.

43
00:02:39.070 --> 00:02:44.280
But again, in relationship to
the Office products from Microsoft.

44
00:02:44.280 --> 00:02:47.300
And this is for,
I would say, upper basics,

45
00:02:47.300 --> 00:02:51.660
to where you understand how to
insert text into a Word document.

46
00:02:51.660 --> 00:02:54.124
So you're comfortable with inserting text,

47
00:02:54.124 --> 00:02:58.040
you really just wanna kinda fancy up
your documents, and add some of those

48
00:02:58.040 --> 00:03:02.289
different elements that will kind of add
a little bit of flair to your document.

49
00:03:02.289 --> 00:03:06.660
And as well making some of those tasks
that you do to be repeatable, and

50
00:03:06.660 --> 00:03:09.860
make it easier for
you in that automation section.

51
00:03:09.860 --> 00:03:13.380
So this would be more towards,
I would say, your advance users.

52
00:03:13.380 --> 00:03:17.520
This is a continuation from
our Word Essentials series so

53
00:03:17.520 --> 00:03:21.600
I will be referring to that series as
well throughout these different episodes.

54
00:03:21.600 --> 00:03:25.347
So make sure you go check that
out in our course library.

55
00:03:25.347 --> 00:03:27.860
What do you need to know
about before we get started?

56
00:03:27.860 --> 00:03:33.060
A foundational knowledge of Word, such as,
do you know how to format your text?

57
00:03:33.060 --> 00:03:34.371
Are you familiar with styles?

58
00:03:34.371 --> 00:03:37.820
Cuz I love styles, and
I'll be talking about them all the time.

59
00:03:37.820 --> 00:03:41.730
So make sure you have a foundational
knowledge of how to create styles, and

60
00:03:41.730 --> 00:03:43.590
how to use styles effectively.

61
00:03:43.590 --> 00:03:48.370
As well as page layout elements, such
as section breaks, page breaks, how to

62
00:03:48.370 --> 00:03:52.660
create columns, and those are again,
covered in that Word Essential shows.

63
00:03:52.660 --> 00:03:56.450
Basic knowledge of how to use your Windows
operating system, how to go to your

64
00:03:56.450 --> 00:03:59.972
file explorer, how to open files,
how to save files and when to print.

65
00:03:59.972 --> 00:04:00.778
And of course,

66
00:04:00.778 --> 00:04:04.693
some familiarity with other Office
products will be helpful here as well.

67
00:04:04.693 --> 00:04:09.133
If you know how to use Excel pretty well,
then that will help you in Word, or

68
00:04:09.133 --> 00:04:13.592
say you know how to use Outlook or
PowerPoint that could be helpful as well.

69
00:04:13.592 --> 00:04:17.568
There's a lot of things that
crossover between the products, so

70
00:04:17.568 --> 00:04:21.991
if you know a little bit about one,
you know a little bit about the other.

71
00:04:21.991 --> 00:04:26.090
And the last parts I like to talk
about are these extra tidbits.

72
00:04:26.090 --> 00:04:30.070
There's always more than one
way to do something in Word.

73
00:04:30.070 --> 00:04:32.950
So if I might be explaining ways one and
two,

74
00:04:32.950 --> 00:04:38.580
there might be ways three and four, that
you might know about that I didn't cover.

75
00:04:38.580 --> 00:04:41.946
That's just the way it works
within these Office products,

76
00:04:41.946 --> 00:04:43.861
there's always different ways.

77
00:04:43.861 --> 00:04:46.917
And it's one I still learn about it too,
where like, I didn't know you could

78
00:04:46.917 --> 00:04:50.100
right-click and use that option or
I didn't know this shortcut did that.

79
00:04:50.100 --> 00:04:54.920
So just know that there will be
multiple ways that I might not cover.

80
00:04:56.060 --> 00:04:58.280
Updates happen, yes, it does.

81
00:04:58.280 --> 00:05:03.840
So as an Office 365 subscriber,
the product is always updating.

82
00:05:03.840 --> 00:05:08.840
And at the time of the recording,
I am on a specific version of whatever

83
00:05:08.840 --> 00:05:12.960
the update was at in
the Office 365 subscription.

84
00:05:12.960 --> 00:05:16.224
So you might see different buttons or
different options, or

85
00:05:16.224 --> 00:05:19.232
things might have changed
a little bit from the time that

86
00:05:19.232 --> 00:05:22.688
I recorded these episodes to
the time that you're watching it.

87
00:05:22.688 --> 00:05:27.076
And that also being said, the way that
your network is organized, let's say,

88
00:05:27.076 --> 00:05:31.465
if you are in a large organization, you
might not get updates as frequently, or

89
00:05:31.465 --> 00:05:34.440
maybe they've turned them off altogether.

90
00:05:34.440 --> 00:05:39.840
So things might be a little bit different,
so if there's some slight variations or

91
00:05:39.840 --> 00:05:43.260
I'm showing you something that you
see in your documents, it's like,

92
00:05:43.260 --> 00:05:45.020
I don't have this available to me.

93
00:05:45.020 --> 00:05:49.310
That is most of the reasons why it
won't be is cuz of the updates and

94
00:05:49.310 --> 00:05:50.800
what version you're on.

95
00:05:50.800 --> 00:05:55.640
Or your network settings to where
maybe they've put a group policy on to

96
00:05:55.640 --> 00:06:00.100
where you're not allowed to
do this particular function,

97
00:06:00.100 --> 00:06:01.980
because they have locked that down.

98
00:06:01.980 --> 00:06:04.170
So those things happen.

99
00:06:04.170 --> 00:06:07.701
Searching for answers,
the oracle of the Internet is out there.

100
00:06:07.701 --> 00:06:12.134
There's a lot of great information that
you can search through whatever search

101
00:06:12.134 --> 00:06:16.248
engine you feel like to say, hey,
I wanna learn how to do x, y, z in Word.

102
00:06:16.248 --> 00:06:19.670
You will have a ton of different
websites that will be able to guide you

103
00:06:19.670 --> 00:06:23.744
in the right direction, and the Microsoft
help files are always really helpful.

104
00:06:23.744 --> 00:06:26.961
That's probably one of the first
places I would start, and

105
00:06:26.961 --> 00:06:29.000
then go on to other places.

106
00:06:29.000 --> 00:06:31.003
And most importantly, have fun.

107
00:06:31.003 --> 00:06:33.743
I know that this can get
really frustrating sometimes,

108
00:06:33.743 --> 00:06:37.620
especially if you're fighting and
like why won't it just move over?

109
00:06:37.620 --> 00:06:39.550
I've been there, I understand.

110
00:06:39.550 --> 00:06:43.540
But that's where you need to just take a
breath, turn it off, go do something else,

111
00:06:43.540 --> 00:06:46.180
come back and then it's poof,
it magically works.

112
00:06:46.180 --> 00:06:48.460
So just try to keep that attitude of hey,

113
00:06:48.460 --> 00:06:51.340
if I don't get it right the first
time I'll try it again.

114
00:06:51.340 --> 00:06:54.090
Especially when you're watching these
episodes, just have a good time.

115
00:06:54.090 --> 00:06:56.390
We like to cut up here and there and

116
00:06:56.390 --> 00:06:59.140
keep it light, and
just keep it fun for all of you.

117
00:06:59.140 --> 00:07:04.213
So I hope you enjoy, and I hope to
see you soon in some episodes soon.

118
00:07:04.213 --> 00:07:06.141
[LAUGH] Have a good time.

119
00:07:06.141 --> 00:07:11.476
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne introduce the basics concepts of working with images. They differentiate file formats and explain the importance of understanding image resolution and dimensions. Vonne also shows some basic techniques for sizing images in Paint and how to add images to a document in Word.
episodes.title: Images Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne demonstrate how to format images in Word. Vonne shows how to properly size images, add word wrap for moving image, crop, and apply preset styles. She also reviews other image adjustments such as brightness and contrast, color correction, and artistic effects. Lastly, she explains when and why you would compress, change, and reset images.
episodes.title: Images: Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Vonne continue the demonstration of formatting image in Word. They discuss how to add alternative text to an image so it can be useful integrating with software designed for visually impaired individuals. Vonne shows us to use intelligent services as well as adding descriptions to images in the format pane.
episodes.title: Images: Format Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne add shapes into documents to enhance the appearance and emphasize text. Vonne shows how to add shapes and then format shapes by resizing, rotating, and changing the color of the fill and outline. She also shows how to add and format text to a shape, format shapes with the format pane, and edit individual points to create custom shape.
episodes.title: Shapes: Add and Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne demonstrate working with multiple shapes and icons. With shapes, Vonne shows how to duplicate, arrange stacking order, align, group and ungroup, and use the selection pane. She also covers how to insert icons, which is only available with an Office 365 subscription.
episodes.title: Multiple Shapes and Icons

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne discuss the purpose of and explain how to use SmartArt in Word. Vonne shows how to add SmartArt from the different galleries and then add shapes and text. She shows how to format individual shapes and/or the whole SmartArt using styles as well as how to resize, wrap text, and align within a document.
episodes.title: Smart Art

episodes.description: Vonne and Cherokee present the foundational knowledge and basic terminology associated with tables in Word.  They discuss the importance of understanding the different mouse cursor icons to able to select the right table element for formatting and table manipulation.  They also demonstrate how to treat a table as a graphical element in a Word document.
episodes.title: Tables: Introduction

episodes.description: Vonne and Cherokee continue to explore tables in Word 2016. Vonne shows how to insert rows and columns, as well as adding text into cells. The ladies discuss why one would or would not want to merge cells, split cells, or split tables. They also explain several ways to modify a table layout such as: specifying height and width, auto-fit options, distribute rows/columns, cell alignment/margins, text directions and more!
episodes.title: Tables: Create and Layout

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Vonne discuss how to convert text into table content and vice versa. Vonne shows how to insert ready-made tables using Quick Tables and how to create custom tables using the draw table command. Vonne also demonstrates how to calculate totals using basic formulas, sorting data by single and multiple levels, and inserting an Excel spreadsheet as an embedded object.
episodes.title: Tables: Create and Layout Part 2

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach discuss how to format tables and cell content. Vonne shows how to apply borders and shading to selected cells using the Table Tools contextual tabs as well as text formatting from the Home tab on the Ribbon. They also demonstrate how to format using styles and how to clear formatting completely.
episodes.title: Tables: Format and Design

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach introduce the foundations of charts in Word 2016.  Vonne demonstrates how to insert charts and input the category and series values for the charts. She also shows how to change the chart type, edit and update chart data, modify chart layouts with Quick layouts, and add chart elements such as data tables and data labels.
episodes.title: Charts

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach continue with charts in Word 2016. In this episode, they focus on formatting chart elements individually with fills and outlines as well as with styles. They also show how to format specific options of chart elements from the format pane. They then explore different type of charts and show how to create and format pie charts.
episodes.title: Charts Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Zach explore using text as graphical elements.  Vonne shows how to insert, format, and modify a text box.  She also shows how to create multiple linked text boxes to flow text from one text box to another. They also show how to insert WordArt as an individual element and how to create hyperlinks in a Word document to external webpages and files as well as internal within a document to headings and bookmarks.
episodes.title: Graphical Text Objects

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the use of templates. They explain the commonly misused and misunderstood concept of a template and how to correctly use a template in Word.  They create documents from the built-in templates from Microsoft as well as creating a custom template from an existing document. They identify the default location of templates within the operating system and the importance of the normal template in Word.
episodes.title: Templates

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the world of Quick Parts and AutoText and how they can help automate insertion of commonly used elements into a document. They also show where to add and manage document properties and how they relate to adding fields and/or Quick Parts into your Word files.
episodes.title: Quick Parts

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne demonstrate how to create, edit, and delete macros. They explain how macros can be helpful in automating repeatable steps, but also emphasize the potential security risk macros can pose if executed from an unknown source.
episodes.title: Macros

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne discuss how to create linked objects in Word, specifically links to Excel content. Additionally, Vonne demonstrates how to update links, change source, and break links.
episodes.title: Linked Objects

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne present the popular mail merge process in Word 2016. In this episode, they explain the elements needed and review the process to perform a mail merge. They demonstrate a completed mail merge with a basic letter.
episodes.title: Mail Merge

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne continue with mail merge in Word 2016. In this episode, they demonstrate how to create labels and envelopes with a mail merge. They also cover how to create a full page of the same label, print a single label on existing label paper, and print a single envelope.
episodes.title: Labels and Envelopes
